intro: Phacelia howellii, commonly known as Howell's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are often branched and upright. Phacelia howellii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
